summary: Backend pagination required by REQ-148 is not evidenced in the provided diff summary (backend/main.mo excerpt shows only imports/types). Frontend appears to add paginated media fetching in the React Query layer (per frontend-file-summaries.txt), but the diff summary also indicates numerous unrelated UI/visual/styling changes that were not requested and may violate the “no UI changes” constraint.

missing_requirements.requirement: Update the backend media listing to implement pagination/chunking so no single response exceeds the IC 2MB limit; stable deterministic ordering across pages; admin-session-token authorization (no public access).
missing_requirements.reason: The diff snippet for backend/main.mo is truncated and does not show any new or modified media-listing method, pagination parameters (limit/cursor/offset), stable ordering, or token-guarded paginated endpoint. No other backend files were changed.
evidence: backend/main.mo (truncated; no listing/pagination changes visible in excerpt)

hallucinated_features.description: Multiple unrelated public/admin UI visual/layout/styling changes (home page banner slider/CTA banner, admin sidebar styling, CRUD table styling, various component text/label changes).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest explicitly disallows changing admin/public UI visuals/layout/routes except minimal data-fetching changes to support pagination. The diff summary describes numerous UI changes unrelated to media pagination.

hallucinated_features.description: Media manager page changes adding separate sections for Home Main Banner (slider) and Home CTA Banner configuration.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by REQ-148/REQ-149 and likely constitutes an admin UI/layout change beyond minimal data-fetching adjustments.
